1. Venous thromboembolism: This is a blood clot that forms in the deep veins of the body, often in the legs, and can travel to the lungs, causing a blockage. It is a condition, not a chemical, but it is often associated with the action of certain chemicals in the body.
2. Coronary event: This is a general term that refers to any abnormal condition affecting the coronary arteries, which supply blood to the heart muscle. It could include conditions such as angina (chest pain due to reduced blood flow to the heart) or myocardial infarction (heart attack). Again, this is not a chemical, but it can be caused by the action of certain chemicals in the body.
3. Stroke: A stroke occurs when the blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced, causing brain cells to die. It can be caused by a variety of factors, including the blockage or rupture of blood vessels in the brain.
4. Breast cancer: This is a type of cancer that starts in the cells of the breast. It is not a chemical, but it can be influenced by the action of certain chemicals in the body.
5. Gallbladder disease: This is a general term that refers to any condition that affects the gallbladder, a small organ located in the upper right part of the abdomen that stores bile produced by the liver. It can be caused by a variety of factors, including the action of certain chemicals in the body.
